page.title: 06THE VILLAGE.
page.content: Harby is in the{Vale of Belvoir}about seven miles from{Belvoir Castle}and about ten miles from{Melton Mowbray. Harby or to give it its old Saxon name Herdebi,is one of a series of ancient settlements situated below a range of ironstone hills.The village was built around a collection of farms and near to the intersection of two important old roads,the Salt Way (Bronze age and Roman) and a green lane. Today there are about three hundred houses and two shops in the village. There is also a Garage,a Village Institute,two Public Houses,a Church and a Chapel. In the Harby Village Plan, published in 1981,the village is described as both a"{farming community , a {dormitory settlement and a minor {centre for a limited range of {community facilities."
